content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
• Consists of a boiler located at (8.0, 20.5) that feeds steam into the power network and several steam engines connected to it.
• One extra steam engine remains unplaced because of severe spatial congestion. Conflicting placements—especially in the region near (8.5, 22.5) where burner‑inserters and transport belts overlap—have prevented the discovery of a clear buildable area.
• In the latest update the agent attempted to clear interference by scanning within a radius of 3 around (8.5, 22.5). Although no interfering entities were detected in that target region, a subsequent search for a buildable area near (8.5, 18.5) triggered an error, leaving the extra steam engine still unplaced.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue:
  - When facing spatial congestion in the boiler zone, remove or reposition conflicting entities (such as burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts) near (8.5, 22.5). Alternately, redesign the adjacent connection interfaces or consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area.

• TypeError During Buildable Area Logging:
  - The error “TypeError: 'Position' object is not callable” indicates that an attribute (likely the center of a bounding box) is being mistakenly invoked as a function. Review the code to access the property (e.g., use buildable_area.center without parentheses) and validate object types before calling them.
